text: William Hilson Pigott (10 March 1839 - 13 March 1909) was an English-born Australian politician. He was born in London to cabinet maker John Allpress Pigott and Margaret Hilson. His family moved to New South Wales in 1841 and Pigott became a solicitor's clerk, qualifying as a solicitor in 1863. In 1863 he married Laura Jane West, with whom he had two sons; a second marriage in 1883 to Louisa Matilda Jones produced a daughter. He practised as a solicitor in Grafton until joining a Sydney firm in 1864. A long-serving Petersham alderman, he was mayor from 1872 to 1880. In 1880 he was elected to the New South Wales Legislative Assembly for Canterbury, serving until his resignation in 1884. He was appointed to the New South Wales Legislative Council in 1887, serving until 1907. Pigott died at Croydon in 1909. ==References== Category:1839 births Category:1909 deaths Category:Mayors of Petersham Category:Members of the New South Wales Legislative Assembly Category:Members of the New South Wales Legislative Council Category:19th-century Australian politicians Category:English emigrants to colonial Australia
